Package vrielynckpieterjan.masterproef.applicationlayer.revocation

Class RevocationCommitment

java.lang.Object
vrielynckpieterjan.masterproef.storagelayer.StorageElementIdentifier
vrielynckpieterjan.masterproef.applicationlayer.revocation.RevocationCommitment
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class RevocationCommitment
extends StorageElementIdentifier
Class representing a revocation commitment, which is a SHA-512 version of a RevocationSecret.
See Also:
Serialized Form
"Implementation Note:"
This class is implemented as a subclass of the StorageElementIdentifier class, due to the fact that RevocationCommitments can also be used as identifiers for the StorageLayer to store RevocationObjects with.

    • isRevealedInStorageLayer

      public boolean isRevealedInStorageLayer​(@NotNull @NotNull StorageLayer storageLayer) throws java.io.IOException
      Method to check if this RevocationCommitment is revealed in the StorageLayer.
      Parameters:
      storageLayer - The StorageLayer.
      Returns:
      True if the RevocationCommitment is revealed; false otherwise.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If the StorageLayer could not be consulted due to an IO-related problem.
